com.truemesh.squiggle.criteria
Class CriteriaExpression

java.lang.Object
  com.truemesh.squiggle.Criteria
      com.truemesh.squiggle.criteria.CriteriaExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
Outputable
public class CriteriaExpression
extends Criteria

Class CriteriaExpression is Criteria class extension that generates the SQL syntax for a compound logic expression in an SQL Where clause. The logic expression that the class generates is a list of criteria terms each separated by an AND or OR operator. Formally, we may express a logic expression in Backus-Naur Form (BNF) as

<expression> ::= <term> | <term> <operator <expression>
<term> ::= <criteria>
<operator> ::= AND | OR

Author:
Derek Mahar

Constructor Detail

CriteriaExpression

public CriteriaExpression(Criteria term)
Initializes a CriteriaExpression with a single criteria term, leaving the trailing criteria expression set to null. This constructor definition represents the rule <expression> ::= <term> in the formal criteria expression syntax.

Parameters:
term - single criteria to assign to this criteria expression.

CriteriaExpression

public CriteriaExpression(Criteria term,
                          int operator,
                          CriteriaExpression expression)
Initializes a CriteriaExpression with an initial criteria term, an operator, and a another trailing criteria expression. Note that this constructor definition is recursive and represents the rule <expression> ::= <term> <operator <expression> in the formal criteria expression syntax.

Parameters:
term - the starting criteria to assign to the new criteria expression.
operator - the infix operator, either AND or OR, that joins the initial criteria with the trailing criteria expression.
expression - the trailing expression to assign to the new criteria expression.

CriteriaExpression

public CriteriaExpression(java.util.List<Criteria> terms,
                          int operator)
Recursively generates a CriteriaExpression from a given list of criteria and an infix operator to join each criteria with the next in the list.

Parameters:
terms - the list of criteria terms from which the constructor generates the new criteria expression.
operator - the infix operator, either AND or OR that joins each criteria term with the next in the list.

write

public void write(Output out)
Writes this criteria expression to the given output destination. If both term and expression are null, this method generates no output. If expression is null, but term is defined, the method writes the term criteria to the output. If both expression and term are defined, however, the method creates a new logic operator object, either AND or OR, assigns it the term and expression, and writes this new operator to the output.

Specified by:
write in interface Outputable
Specified by:
write in class Criteria
Parameters:
out - the output destination to which to write this criteria expression.
See Also:
